```{r Combine ALL zoops}
# Combine spat and temp and plot together over time
options(scipen = 999)
zoop_abund <- allzoopcomp %>%
  mutate(year = format(date, "%Y")) %>%
  mutate(location = case_when(grepl("D", site) ~ "DI",
                              grepl("Q", site) ~ "DI",
                              grepl("J", site) ~ "JS")) %>%
  select(sample_id, date, year, location, site, phylum, final_category, plot.taxon, total_count, abundance) %>%
  mutate(plot.taxon = case_when(plot.taxon %in% c("Fish", "Insect", "Jellyfish") ~ "Other",
                                TRUE ~ plot.taxon)) %>%
  filter(total_count != "NA", phylum != 'NA', site != "QU39") %>%
  mutate(location = factor(location, levels = c("JS", "DI"))) %>% 
  group_by(sample_id, year, date, location, plot.taxon) %>%
  summarise(totcount = sum(total_count, na.rm = T), totabund = sum(abundance,na.rm = T)) %>% 
  group_by(sample_id, year, date, location) %>%
  mutate(total = sum(totcount), relabund = ((totcount/total)*100))
  
 zoop_tperiod <- zoop_abund %>%
   mutate(yday = yday(ymd(date)), week = week(ymd(date)), year = year(ymd(date))) %>%
  filter(date > "2015-05-01") %>%
  mutate(year = as.factor(year)) %>%
  mutate(tperiod = case_when(location == "DI" & year == 2015 & yday < 141 ~ "Early", #ydays for each migration timing group based on Brett's cumulative catch over the sampling period using Q1 and Q3
                         location == "DI" & year == 2015 & yday > 140 & yday < 154 ~ "Peak",
                         location == "DI" & yday > 153 ~ "Late",
                         location == "DI" & year == 2016 & yday < 139 ~ "Early",
                         location == "DI" & year == 2016 & yday > 138 & yday < 155 ~ "Peak",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2015 & yday < 148 ~ "Early",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2015 & yday > 147 & yday < 159 ~ "Peak",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2015 & yday > 158 ~ "Late",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2016 & yday < 149 ~ "Early",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2016 & yday > 148 & yday < 164 ~ "Peak",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2016 & yday > 164 ~ "Late")) %>%
  mutate(tperiod = as.factor(tperiod)) %>%
   group_by(location, year, tperiod, plot.taxon) %>%
   mutate(mean_abund = mean(relabund, na.rm = T), sd_abund = sd(relabund, na.rm = T)) %>%
   select(c(2, 4:5, 12:14)) %>%
   distinct()

zoop_abund$year <- format(as.factor(zoop_abund$year))
zoop_abund$date_m <- format(as.Date(zoop_abund$date), "%b-%d")
zoop_abund$date_m1 <- as.Date(zoop_abund$date_m, format = "%b-%d")

zoop_samplesize <- allzoopcomp %>%
  mutate(location = case_when(grepl("D", site) ~ "DI",
                              grepl("Q", site) ~ "DI",
                              grepl("J", site) ~ "JS")) %>%
        mutate(year = format(date, "%Y"), location = factor(location, levels = c("JS", "DI"))) %>%
        select(sample_id, date, year, location, site, phylum, plot.taxon, total_count, abundance) %>%
        filter(total_count != "NA", phylum != 'NA', site != "QU39")

zoop_samplesize$year <- format(as.factor(zoop_samplesize$year))
zoop_samplesize$date_m <- format(as.Date(zoop_samplesize$date), "%b-%d")
zoop_samplesize$date_m1 <- as.Date(zoop_samplesize$date_m, format = "%b-%d")

samplesize <- zoop_samplesize %>%
  group_by(year, date_m1, location) %>%
  summarise(count = length(unique(sample_id)))

##plot relative abundance for each taxon for the taxa that contribute >5%, fill with taxon
zoop_abund_p <- ggplot(data = zoop_abund, aes(x = date_m1, y = totcount)) + 
  geom_col(aes(fill = plot.taxon), position = "fill", width = 1, colour = "black", size = 0.3) +
  theme_classic()+
  facet_grid(vars(year), vars(location), scales = "free") +
  scale_fill_manual(
          values = c("tomato3", "darkorange1", "mediumpurple3", "mediumseagreen", "pink3", "goldenrod1", "royalblue3", "grey40"),
                labels = c("Amphipod", "Barnacle", "Cladoceran", "Copepod", "Decapod", "Euphausiid", "Larvacean", "Other")
  ) +
  theme(
    axis.text.x = element_text(size = 10, angle = 90, vjust = 0.5),
    axis.text.y = element_text(size = 10),
    axis.title.x = element_blank(),
    axis.title.y = element_text(size = 12, margin = margin(r=10)),
    panel.background = element_rect(fill = "white", colour = "grey50"),
    strip.background = element_blank(),
    strip.text = element_text(size = 10),
    legend.title=element_blank(),
    legend.text = element_text(size = 10),
    legend.key.size = unit(0.7, "line"),
    legend.position = "bottom",
    legend.direction = "horizontal",
    legend.justification = "center"
  ) +
  labs(y = "Proportion of Sample") +
  scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0,0.04), breaks = seq(0,1.0,0.2))

zoop_abund_p +  
  scale_x_date(date_breaks ="1 week", date_labels = "%b-%d", limits = c(as.Date(c("2023-05-01", "2023-07-10")))) + 
  guides(fill = guide_legend(nrow = 2, byrow = TRUE)) +
  geom_text(data = samplesize, aes(x = date_m1, y = 1.07, label = count, fill = NULL), size = 2.2)

ggsave("../figs/zoops/allzoops_overtime.png", width = 18, height = 14, units = "cm")
```

```{r All Zoop Stats}
zoop_biomass <- allzoopww %>%
  select(sample_id, site, date, biomass) %>%
  group_by(sample_id, site, date) %>%
  summarise(biomass = sum(biomass, na.rm = T)) %>%
  filter(biomass > 0, site != "QU39")

zoop_abundance <- allzoopcomp %>%
  select(sample_id, site, date, abundance) %>%
  group_by(sample_id, site, date) %>%
  summarise(abundance = sum(abundance, na.rm = T)) %>%
  filter(abundance > 0, site != "QU39")
  
zoop_data <- left_join(zoop_abundance, zoop_biomass) %>%
  filter(biomass != "NA")

options(scipen = 999)
zoop_dat <- zoop_data %>%
  filter(date > "2015-05-01") %>%
  mutate(location = case_when(grepl("D", site) ~ "DI",
                              grepl("Q", site) ~ "DI",
                              grepl("J", site) ~ "JS")) %>% 
  mutate(size = biomass/abundance) %>%
  mutate(yday = yday(ymd(date)), week = week(ymd(date)), year = year(ymd(date))) %>%
  mutate(year = as.factor(year)) %>%
  mutate(tperiod = case_when(location == "DI" & year == 2015 & yday < 141 ~ "Early", #ydays for each migration timing group based on Brett's cumulative catch over the sampling period using Q1 and Q3
                         location == "DI" & year == 2015 & yday > 140 & yday < 154 ~ "Peak",
                         location == "DI" & yday > 153 ~ "Late",
                         location == "DI" & year == 2016 & yday < 139 ~ "Early",
                         location == "DI" & year == 2016 & yday > 138 & yday < 155 ~ "Peak",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2015 & yday < 148 ~ "Early",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2015 & yday > 147 & yday < 159 ~ "Peak",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2015 & yday > 158 ~ "Late",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2016 & yday < 149 ~ "Early",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2016 & yday > 148 & yday < 164 ~ "Peak",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2016 & yday > 164 ~ "Late")) %>%
  mutate(tperiod = as.factor(tperiod)) %>%
  group_by(tperiod, location) %>%
  mutate(mean_biom = mean(biomass), sd_biom = sd(biomass), log_biom = log(mean_biom), mean_abund = mean(abundance), sd_abund = sd(abundance), log_abund = log(mean_abund), mean_size = mean(size), sd_size = sd(size), log_size = log(mean_size))

hist(zoop_dat$abundance)

DI_dat <- zoop_dat %>%
  filter(location == "DI")
JS_dat <- zoop_dat %>%
  filter(location == "JS")

# Data are non-parametric
kruskal.test(size~tperiod, data = JS_dat)
# only sig difs were in biomass between years and size between time periods - use post-hoc tests

# post hoc
dunnTest(biomass ~ year, data = zoop_dat, method = "bonferroni")
# mean size greater in JS in peak vs early


ggplot(DI_dat, aes(x = tperiod, y = biomass, fill = year)) + 
  geom_boxplot(outlier.shape = NA) + 
  geom_jitter(width = 0.2) + 
  theme(legend.position="top") 
  #scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0,2000))
```

```{r Prey Comp Cluster}
zoop_abund2 <- allzoopcomp %>%
  mutate(yday = yday(date), year = year(ymd(date))) %>%
  filter(date > "2015-05-01") %>%
  mutate(location = case_when(grepl("D", site) ~ "DI",
                              grepl("Q", site) ~ "DI",
                              grepl("J", site) ~ "JS")) %>%
  mutate(tperiod = case_when(location == "DI" & year == 2015 & yday < 141 ~ "DI_Early", #ydays for each migration timing group based on Brett's cumulative catch over the sampling period using Q1 and Q3
                         location == "DI" & year == 2015 & yday > 140 & yday < 154 ~ "DI_Peak",
                         location == "DI" & yday > 153 ~ "DI_Late",
                         location == "DI" & year == 2016 & yday < 139 ~ "DI_Early",
                         location == "DI" & year == 2016 & yday > 138 & yday < 155 ~ "DI_Peak",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2015 & yday < 148 ~ "JS_Early",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2015 & yday > 147 & yday < 159 ~ "JS_Peak",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2015 & yday > 158 ~ "JS_Late",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2016 & yday < 149 ~ "JS_Early",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2016 & yday > 148 & yday < 164 ~ "JS_Peak",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2016 & yday > 164 ~ "JS_Late")) %>%
  group_by(sample_id, plot.taxon) %>%
  mutate(total = sum(total_count)) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  distinct() %>%
  group_by(sample_id) %>%
  mutate(relabund = (total/sum(total))) %>%
  mutate(arcsin = ((2/pi)*asin(sqrt(relabund)))) %>% # data need to be transformed for Bray-Curtis analysis
  select(sample_id, year, tperiod, site, location, plot.taxon, arcsin) %>%
  mutate(tperiod = factor(tperiod, levels = c("DI_Early", "DI_Peak", "DI_Late", "JS_Early", "JS_Peak", "JS_Late"))) %>%
  distinct() %>%
  filter(sample_id != "QPK259")


clusdata <- spread(zoop_abund2, key = plot.taxon, value = arcsin) 
clusdata[is.na(clusdata)] <- 0

#converting it to a dataframe and setting rownames as the first column and then only selecting the taxonomic data columns
# as part of the data prep for Bray-Curtis
clusdata <- data.frame(clusdata)
rownames(clusdata) = clusdata[,1]
bc_dat <- clusdata[6:16]

#vegdist uses the vegan package to calculate the distances between variables
bc_dist <- vegdist(bc_dat, method = "bray")

#hclust creates the dendrogram by calculating the amount of dissimilarity between clusters,
# average calculates the distance between all the different values in each group and then averages them
bc_clust <- hclust(bc_dist, method = "average")

# plotting the Bray-Curtis dissimilarity, I made it as a dendrogram to flatten out the bottom
den_clust = as.dendrogram(bc_clust)
plot(den_clust)

# NbClust using 30 indices and the majority rule: suggests 2 clusters. Move ahead with this statistic. 2 Clusters, but visual inspection of dendrogram shows that there are 3 sub clusters in the DI cluster (excluding outliers) that roughly correspond to migration timing. Use k = 8 to identify subclusters and plot in NMDS
mydata <- bc_dat
NbClust(data = mydata, diss = NULL, distance = "euclidean",
        min.nc = 2, max.nc = 20, method = "average")

den_clust <- den_clust %>%
  color_branches(k=3)
plot(den_clust, ylab = "Bray-Curtis Dissimilarity", ylim = c(0,0.6))


#simper analysis using the BC dissimilarity matrix and grouping variable. Produces table with average contribution to dissimilary, avg abundances in groups a and b, and the cumulative sum of the contributions to dissimilarity. Use these values for Table S2.3 in sup mat
options(scipen = 100)
zoop_meta <- zoop_abund2 %>%
  select(1:5) %>%
  distinct()

sim <- with(zoop_meta, simper(bc_dat, tperiod)) 
summary(sim)
sim #lists most influential species and their cumulative contributions

#to get the overall dissimilarity between the groups (where the branches are in the dendrogram)
lapply(sim, FUN = function(x){x$overall})
```


```{r Zoop sizes ALL DATA}
# Combine spat and temp and plot SIZES over time
zoop_size_abund <- allzoopcomp %>%
        mutate(year = format(date, "%Y")) %>%
  mutate(location = case_when(grepl("D", site) ~ "DI",
                              grepl("Q", site) ~ "DI",
                              grepl("J", site) ~ "JS")) %>%
        select(date, year, location, site, size_class, total_count, abundance) %>%
        filter(total_count != "NA", size_class != 'NA') %>%
  mutate(size_class = case_when(size_class %in% c("<1", "1-2", "<2") ~ "<2",
                                TRUE ~ size_class)) %>%
        mutate(location = factor(location, levels = c("JS", "DI")), size_class = factor(size_class, levels = c("<2", "2-5", "5-10", ">10"))) %>% 
        group_by(year, date, location, size_class) %>%
        summarise(totcount = sum(total_count), totabund = sum(abundance)) %>%
  mutate(yday = yday(date)) %>%
  mutate(tperiod = case_when(location == "DI" & year == 2015 & yday < 141 ~ "Early", #ydays for each migration timing group based on Brett's cumulative catch over the sampling period using Q1 and Q3
                         location == "DI" & year == 2015 & yday > 140 & yday < 154 ~ "Peak",
                         location == "DI" & yday > 153 ~ "Late",
                         location == "DI" & year == 2016 & yday < 139 ~ "Early",
                         location == "DI" & year == 2016 & yday > 138 & yday < 155 ~ "Peak",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2015 & yday < 148 ~ "Early",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2015 & yday > 147 & yday < 159 ~ "Peak",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2015 & yday > 158 ~ "Late",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2016 & yday < 149 ~ "Early",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2016 & yday > 148 & yday < 164 ~ "Peak",
                         location == "JS" & year == 2016 & yday > 164 ~ "Late")) %>%
  group_by(location, year, tperiod) %>%
  mutate(location_tot = sum(totabund, na.rm = T)) %>%
  group_by(location, year, size_class, tperiod) %>%
  mutate(class_tot = sum(totabund, na.rm = T), class_prop = (class_tot/location_tot)*100)
```
